page.title: 09UPPER LOWER HOUSE FARM.
page.content: Upper Lower House Farm is situated in Michaelchurch Escley.It is a very interesting place with very few modern conveniences.They have{no electricity} and use{paraffin lights.}Their only toilet is an old one at the end of the garden.The house has a{bread oven}in the first room,with a flagstone floor.The front door is made out of solid oak.In the parlour they have an old stone shelf on which they used to kill pigs.Outside there is an old barn in which there are fine examples of {oak crutch trusses.}These beams have kept quite nicely.There is a long and unmade lane between the house and the road. Upper Lower House was once used as an{illegal brewery. } Today the house is rented by a family with three young children.
